basics.name: Anat Amar
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Dynamic and passionate Computer Science professional with proficiency in multiple programming languages, including Java, C++, Perl, JavaScript, React.js, HTML, and CSS. Experienced in web development from a previous role at The Den. Recently relocated to Austin, I am eager to apply my technical skills and contribute to a dynamic company's growth. Open to diverse computer science roles to broaden my expertise and make a meaningful impact.

work.summary: Web Developer at The Den Social Wellness Club (2023)
highlights: Led website development, showcasing a fusion of technical expertise and creative finesse.
Designed an engaging homepage with captivating video content, enhancing The Den's online presence.
Implemented secure features, including an investor login and exclusive document access pages, demonstrating a commitment to robust data protection measures.
Proficient in a diverse tech stack (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Bootstrap, Meteor) for a polished and secure user interface.

work.summary: Front-End Developer at Hawaiâ€™i Digital Health Lab (2023)
highlights: Led the design and implementation of the user interface and admin page for an innovative Social-Gaming-Web-Platform, contributing to the evolution of the digital health industry.
Ensured a flawless user experience through unwavering commitment to quality, conducting extensive testing using TestCafe.
Utilized JavaScript, HTML, CSS, React.js, and Bootstrap to craft a seamless and engaging platform that redefined the gaming experience.

volunteer.summary: Researched and tracked scholarship opportunities, keeping members informed through meetings, email, and our PTK Canvas site.

Volunteered for Sole Hope, creating shoe patterns and preparing fabric for shoes to aid patients in Uganda. Developed valuable skills in textile production and pattern-making, fostering a deeper commitment to service.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
